Pre-Game Insights: India head coach Manolo Márquez emphasized the importance of playing good football and not just focusing on winning the tournament.
Márquez said he prefers to play a good game than to win the tournament 1-0 with a handball goal.
Defender Jay Gupta shared that the mood in the dressing room is positive after the arrival of Márquez at the helm.
Syrian coach José Lana said India are a great team and hopes to keep progressing and do even better against India.
Lana praised India's organisation, their ability to play when they don't have the ball, and their fast-paced game when they do have the ball.
Goalkeeper Ahmad Madania said Syria are technically and psychologically ready for the match against India.
